intro: Fordiophyton polystegium, commonly known as the redstem filaree, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and often covered in fine hairs. The flowers are usually pink or red, and the plant produces small, dry fruits that contain one or two seeds.
